message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about natural language processing and specifically focuses on reading comprehension tasks. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also proposes a novel gating mechanism, which involves modeling the interaction between questions and paragraphs, and improving the performance on reading comprehension tasks. This suggests that the paper could also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the paper also demonstrates the generality of the gating mechanism by showing improved results on a social media tag prediction task, which could make it relevant to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category.
